info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued February 16 at 10:07PM CST until February 16 at 11:00PM CST by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM CST FOR WESTERN SCURRY...NORTHWESTERN MITCHELL...BORDEN...HOWARD... EASTERN MARTIN AND EASTERN DAWSON COUNTIES... At 1007 PM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Fluvanna to 10 miles southwest of J B Thomas Reservoir to 6 miles northeast of Lomax, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Big Spring, Ackerly, Gail, Stanton, Coahoma, Forsan, Sand Springs, Fluvanna, Lomax, J B Thomas Reservoir, Luther, Vincent, Knapp, Big Spring Country Club, Big Spring McMahon-Wrinkle Airpark, Knott, Vealmoor and Elbow. This includes Interstate 20 between mile markers 158 and 195. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
